page.title: 11BATTLE QUINCENTENARY
page.content: Throughout the summer of 1985 a variety of events were staged to commemorate the 500th anniversary of the Battle of Bosworth. The festivites were opened on 27th July, by their Royal Highnesses, the Prince and Princess of Wales. Each Sunday throughout the summer was nominated as a special event day and the events included Trial by Combat, Archery Tournaments, Jousting and on the 22nd August, a full scale re-enactment of the battle itself. Quite apart from the spectacle of knights in armour there were also numerous lectures on mediaeval history, the battle and warfare and armoury of the period together with a mediaeval banquet, performances of Shakespeare's Richard 111 and a memorial service on the morning of Quincentenary Day.
